content: a simple triangular scarf knit flat using *assigned pooling yarn *assigned pooling takes place when a change in stitch and texture is allocated to changes in colour of a variegated skein of yarn the size can be easily adjusted by knitting more/ less row different weight yarn and/ or needles can be substituted to achieve different effect and size **yarn** 100g of *assigned pooling fingering 4ply/ sock weight yarn approximately 365 metres/ 399 yards the sample in the photo is knit in beautiful knitters soho super-wash bluefaced leicester hight twist in colour orchid **needles & notions** 3 5 mm us 3 60 cm or longer circular needles tapestry needle **gauge** 6 stitches = 1 inch in garter stitch **size** approximately 120 cm/ 47 inches long and 52 cm/ 20 5 inches deep
